result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Ray Raspberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample unless previously provided. Pay DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.  To be collected by DOC not to exceed 25%.  Balance and supervision fees  to be paid while on Extended  supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Job and vocational training.
Mental health evaluation. Follow thru with any treatment recommended.

No controlled substances other than those legally prescribed by a dulylicensed physician for his mental or physical needs.
No alcohol.
No contact with No. #1 Chinese Restaurant on 6119 W. North Avenue, City of Wauwatosa, County of Milwaukee, WI.
No contact with Golden Chicken, 2532 W. Wisconsin Avenue, City and County of Milwaukee, WI.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Ray Raspberry

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (41 pages) commencing 05/15/2014 by Court Reporter William Carpenter.
Case converted to e-file at request of Court Reporting Services.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS ATTN. RECORDS 2909 E PARK AVE. CHIPPEWA FALLS WI 54729

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order - ERP, signed and filed. 

It is Ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. 

It is Further Ordered that the Warden/ Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 20 Judge Wall.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Branch 20 in motion hearing; Attorney Schlieben in another court, and cannot come back this afternoon.  Parties agree to continue this case to 5/15/14 at 8:30 a.m.
At request of counsel, case is scheduled for plea AND sentencing before Branch 20 on 5/14/14.  Copy of email printed and filed. rn

Attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben in court, defendant Michael Ray Raspberry not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard appeared for Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date in May; defendant's revocation hearing was adjourned.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben in court, defendant Michael Ray Raspberry not in court, in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has an upcoming revocation hearing.  Case is continued for scheduling before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Ray Raspberry in court with Jessica Shank, student intern under the supervision of Matt Lamke for attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Defendant Michael Ray Raspberry in custody.  Michael Lonski for Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Golden Chicken at 2532 W Wisconsin Ave., Milwaukee, WI or Moon L

Defendant Michael Ray Raspberry in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Michael Ray Raspberry in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
